document.docAuthor: Asenjo, Angélico, Irmler, Ulrich, Klimaszewski, Jan, Chandler, Donald S., Fierros-López, Hugo Eduardo & Vieira, Juliana S.
document.masterDocTitle: Staphylinidae (Insecta: Coleoptera) in Latin America: synopsis, annotated catalog, diversity and distribution

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Staphylinidae (Insecta: Coleoptera) in Latin America: synopsis, annotated catalog, diversity and distribution

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Leucoparyphus
Kraatz, 1857a: 393
[synonymized by
Thomson 1861: 153
] Type species:
Staphylinus silphoides Linnaeus, 1767

subSubSection.paragraph: 1 species is included in this genus from the West Indies and South America.
Key: Campbell 1975a: 177 (some species of America north of Mexico ); Campbell 1994: 140 (some species of the genus).
West Indies: Puerto Rico , US Virgin Isl., Guadeloupe , St. Vincent & Grenadines , Barbados , Grenada , Trinidad- Tobago .
Other regions: Nearctic, Palaearctic, Ethiopian, Madagascan, Oriental .

bibRefCitation.author: Campbell, J. M.
bibRefCitation.refString: Campbell, J. M. (1994) Cileoporus, a new genus of rove beetles from Central and South America (Coleoptera, Staphylinidae, Tachyporinae). Studies on Neotropical Fauna and Environment, 29 (3), 125 - 144. https: // doi. org / 10.1080 / 01650529409360925

subSubSection.paragraph: 2 species are known from and are restricted to Central and South America.
Central America: Guatemala , Costa Rica , Panama .
South America: Colombia , Ecuador , Brazil , Argentina .
80 species ( 1 in Dominican amber) are included in this genus from Latin America.
Key: Blackwelder 1943: 512 (species of the West Indies); Campbell 1975a: 177 (some species of America north of Mexico ).

West Indies: Cuba , Cayman Is., Jamaica , Haiti , Dominican Republic , Puerto Rico , US Virgin Isl., Antigua & Barbuda , Montserrat , Guadeloupe , Dominica , St. Lucia , St. Vincent & Grenadines , Grenada , Trinidad- Tobago .
Central America: Mexico , Guatemala , Belize , Honduras , El Salvador , Nicaragua , Costa Rica , Panama .
South America: Colombia , Venezuela , Guyana , French Guiana , Galapagos Isl., Peru , Bolivia , Brazil , Paraguay , Uruguay , Chile ?, Argentina .
Other regions: Nearctic, Palaearctic, Ethiopian, Madagascan, Oriental , Australian, Oceanic.

bibRefCitation.author: Coiffait, H. & Saiz, F.
bibRefCitation.refString: Coiffait, H. & Saiz, F. (1968) Les Staphylinidae (sensu lato) du Chili. In: Deboutteville, C. & Rapoport, E. (Eds.), Biologie de L'Amerique Australe. Volume IV. Etudes sur la faune du sol. Documents Biogeographiques et Ecologiques. Centre National de la Recherche Scientifique, Paris, pp. 339 - 468.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type species:
Tachinus luteonitens Fairmaire & Germain, 1862
2 species are included in this genus from South America.
Characters/Description: Coiffait & Sáiz 1968: 411 (characters); Campbell 1994: 141 (characters in key). Distribution.
38 species are included in this genus from Latin America.
West Indies: Cuba , Jamaica , Haiti , Dominican Republic , Puerto Rico , Montserrat , Guadeloupe , St. Vincent & Grenadines , Trinidad-Tobago.
Central America: Mexico , Guatemala , Nicaragua , Costa Rica , Panama .
South America: Colombia , Venezuela , Peru , Bolivia , Brazil , Chile , Argentina .
Other regions: Nearctic, Palaearctic, Ethiopian, Madagascan, Oriental , Australian, Oceanic.

bibRefCitation.author: Kraatz, G.
bibRefCitation.refString: Kraatz, G. (1859 a) Die Staphylinen-Fauna von Ostindien, insbesondere der Insel Ceylan. Nicolaische Verlagsbuchhandlung, Berlin. 196 pp., 3 pls. https: // doi. org / 10.5962 / bhl. title. 66002

subSubSection.paragraph: 6 species are included in this genus from Central and South America.
Characters/Description: Campbell 1973a: 1016 (characters); Campbell 1994: 140 (characters in key); Navarrete- Heredia et al. 2002: 106 (characters in key).
Central America: Mexico , Guatemala , Costa Rica , Panama .
Other regions: Nearctic, Palaearctic, Ethiopian, Oriental , Australian.

bibRefCitation.author: Gravenhorst, J. L. C.
bibRefCitation.refString: Gravenhorst, J. L. C. (1802) Coleoptera Microptera Brunsvicensia nec non exoticorum quotquot exstant in collectionibus entomologorum Brunsvicensium in genera familiae et species distribuit. C. Reichard, Brunsuigae [Braunschweig]. lxvi + 206 pp.

bibRefCitation.author: Ullrich, W. G.
bibRefCitation.refString: Ullrich, W. G. (1975) Monographie der gattung Tachinus Gravenhorst (Coleoptera: Staphylinidae), mit Bemerkungen zur Phylogenie und Verbreitung der Arten. Privately published, Kiel. 365 pp., 61 pls.

subSubSection.paragraph: 8 species are included in this genus from Central and South America.
Central America: Mexico , Guatemala , Honduras , Panama .
Other regions: Nearctic, Palaearctic, Ethiopian, Oriental .
9 species are included in this genus from Central America. Characters/Description: Campbell 1979: 5 (characters); Campbell 1994: 140 (characters in key); Navarrete-
Heredia et al. 2002: 106 (characters in key). Key: Campbell 1979: 8 (subgenera and species of the New World). Distribution.
Central America: Mexico , Guatemala , Costa Rica .
Other regions: Nearctic, Palearctic, Ethiopian, Oriental , Australian.

bibRefCitation.author: Silvestri, F.
bibRefCitation.refString: Silvestri, F. (1946 b) Primo contributo alla conoscenza dei termitofili viventi con specie de Syntermes. Commentationes Pontificia Academia Scientiarum, 9 (13), 515 - 559. [Note: nominal year of publication 1945]

subSubSection.paragraph: Only one species is known from and is restricted to South America.
